reference.shortdesc: The attributedef element specifies an attribute that is bound to a set of controlled values. This binding restricts the permissible values for the attribute to the set of controlled values.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The attributedef element is specialized from data. It is defined in the subject scheme module.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: , status and base from , , , and the attributes defined below.

dlentry.dd: Specifies the attribute that is bound to a set of enumerated values

example.title: Example
example.p: In the following code sample, the enumeration definition for the otherprops attribute limits the permissable values to the subject "values-otherprops". This means that the only valid value for the otherprops attribute is "examples".
example.codeblock:
<subjectScheme>
<!-- DEFINE SETS OF CONTROLLED VALUES -->
<!-- Values for @otherprops --> <subjectdef keys="values-otherprops"> <subjectdef keys="examples"/> </subjectdef>
<!-- BINDS SETS OF CONTROLLED VALUES -->
<!-- Binding for @otherprops --> <enumerationdef> <attributedef name="otherprops"/> <subjectdef keyref="values-otherprops"/> </enumerationdef>
</subjectScheme>
